meanings.definition: Excessive or extreme in behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: She showed immoderate excitement when she saw the puppy.
meanings.sent2: His immoderate spending habits led to financial trouble.
meanings.sent3: The immoderate laughter at the silly joke filled the room.
meanings.sent4: Her immoderate love for chocolate was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The immoderate heat made everyone sweat profusely.

meanings.sent1: The immoderate demands of the project were impossible to meet.
meanings.sent2: His immoderate ambition drove him to work day and night.
meanings.sent3: The immoderate size of the ice cream cone made her eyes widen in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The immoderate speed of the car made her heart race with fear.
meanings.sent5: The immoderate noise from the party kept the neighbors awake all night.
